subject: Home & DIY
title: Phantom Power Drains Your Wallet Silently
description: A micro-lesson that makes Phantom Power Drains Your Wallet Silently usable.

hook.text: Devices plugged in but off still draw electricity. This 'phantom power' costs the average home $100-$200 per year.

buildup.text: TVs, game consoles, chargers, and coffee makers draw standby power to keep clocks, LEDs, and instant-on features ready.

discovery.text: Phantom loads account for 5-10% of residential electricity use. Nationally, that's enough power for 11 million homes.

twist.text: Some devices draw nearly as much power in standby as when active. An older cable box uses 35 watts even when off.

climax.text: Smart power strips cut phantom power on their own. They sense when a device turns off and kill power to accessories.

punchline.text: Your devices are spending money while you sleep.

quiz.question: What percentage of home electricity does phantom power typically account for?
